author: marcus.johnson
text: Found the root cause of the export issue. It's the cursor reset bug in v2.14.5. Fix is ready in PR #356 ‚Äî just 12 lines. All unit tests pass. Need to validate on a large dataset before shipping.

author: james.liu
text: @marcus.johnson I can help test. I have a 100K row dataset from the load test suite. Want me to spin up a staging instance with your branch?

author: marcus.johnson
text: @james.liu yes please! The branch is fix/export-cursor-reset. If it passes on 100K rows I'm confident we can ship.

author: tom.anderson
text: I can fast-track the deploy once the fix is validated. We have a maintenance window at 1pm ‚Äî I'll prep the release pipeline.

author: pagerduty-bot
text: üî¥ P0 INCIDENT OPEN: Data export timeouts affecting Enterprise customers. 3 tickets: TICKET-4518, TICKET-4521, TICKET-4523. Escalated by Acme Corp VP Engineering. Incident commander: @alex.chen

author: marcus.johnson
text: Root cause identified: batch cursor regression in v2.14.5 (shipped Feb 3). Fix in PR #356. ETA for production deploy: ~3 hours pending staging validation.

author: sarah.kim
text: Alex ‚Äî heads up, David is asking about the Acme Corp escalation. Please loop him in on status. Also the sprint 13 planning at 3pm conflicts with the arch review at 4pm ‚Äî Marcus can't be in both. How do you want to handle?

author: priya.patel
text: Is the 2pm call with Acme Corp's VP still happening? I was going to present the Dashboard V2 mockups to the design team at 2pm. Can reschedule if needed.

author: alert-bot
text: ‚ö†Ô∏è ALERT: Export worker queue depth at 847 (threshold: 100). Retried exports accumulating. Recommendation: pause retries until fix deployed.

author: james.liu
text: Staging validation complete on fix/export-cursor-reset. 100K rows exported in 45 seconds (was timing out before). LGTM for production. @marcus.johnson @tom.anderson
